intro: Deeringia humbertiana, commonly known as the Humbert's deeringia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to deep red. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
